issue.title: Error when running speed test on ARM(Raspberry Pi 4)
issue.body:
Hello, I want to use liboqs in my Raspberry Pi, so I clone version 0.7.2 to Raspberry Pi. Then I compile on Raspberry Pi rather than use cross compilation. I use `cmake -GNinja -DOQS_USE_OPENSSL=OFF .. && ninja`, it can compile successfully.  I can run `example_kem`, it shows
```
[example_stack] OQS_KEM_frodokem_640_aes operations completed.
[example_heap]  OQS_KEM_frodokem_640_aes operations completed.
```
, I think it works well. But when I run `speed_kem`, some errors occurred, it shows `Illegal instruction`, the full output as follows:
```
pi@raspberrypi:~/liboqs-0.7.2/build/tests $ ./speed_kem
Configuration info
==================
Target platform:  armv7l-Linux-5.15.61-v7l+
Compiler:         gcc (10.2.1)
Compile options:  [-Werror;-Wall;-Wextra;-Wpedantic;-Wstrict-prototypes;-Wshadow;-Wformat=2;-Wfloat-equal;-Wwrite-strings;-Wstrict-overflow;-ggdb3;-Wbad-function-cast]
OQS version:      0.7.2
Git commit:       unknown
OpenSSL enabled:  No
AES:              C
SHA-2:            C
SHA-3:            C
OQS build flags:  OQS_OPT_TARGET=auto CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Debug
CPU exts compile-time:

Speed test
==========
Started at 2022-10-24 09:39:20
Operation                            | Iterations | Total time (s) | Time (us): mean | pop. stdev | CPU cycles: mean          | pop. stdev
------------------------------------ | ----------:| --------------:| ---------------:| ----------:| -------------------------:| ----------:
Classic-McEliece-348864              |            |                |                 |            |                           |
Illegal instruction
```
Please help me to solve this problem, thanks for your help.

issue.title: [falcon] Signature encoding
issue.body:
Falcon may produce both variable and fixed length of signatures. As per spec v1.2, point 3.11.3, the header encodes signature "type" (fixed/variable):

```
Bits cc are 01 or 10 to specify the encoding method for s. Encoding 01 uses the compression
algorithm described in Section 3.11.2; encoding 10 is alternate uncompressed encoding in which
each coefficient of s is encoded over a fixed number of bits.
```

There are actually 2 fixed-size formats - "PADDED" and "CT". The "CT" format is used by OQS, as the library uses constant-time hash-to-point function (``hash_to_point_ct()``).

https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs/blob/222374e0676a2b941e2f912a2a7d9ce5845c83a3/src/sig/falcon/pqclean_falcon-512_clean/pqclean.c#L188

In that case, the ``cc`` bits should be set to ``10``, but instead they are set to ``01``
https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs/blob/222374e0676a2b941e2f912a2a7d9ce5845c83a3/src/sig/falcon/pqclean_falcon-512_clean/pqclean.c#L309
